input: Bob is nice. Bob is white. Bob is young. Charlie is furry. Charlie is nice. Charlie is rough. Charlie is smart. Charlie is young. Gary is furry. Gary is nice. Harry is nice. Harry is red. Harry is rough. Harry is smart. All smart, nice people are white. If someone is furry then they are smart. Furry, white people are rough. If someone is rough and white then they are red. Red, furry people are nice. If someone is red and furry then they are young. If Harry is rough and Harry is white then Harry is furry. Question: Gary is young.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bob : obj
constant Charlie : obj
constant Gary : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop
constant Young : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Rough : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Nice Bob
axiom T2 : White Bob
axiom T3 : Young Bob
axiom T4 : Furry Charlie
axiom T5 : Nice Charlie
axiom T6 : Rough Charlie
axiom T7 : Smart Charlie
axiom T8 : Young Charlie
axiom T9 : Furry Gary
axiom T10 : Nice Gary
axiom T11 : Nice Harry
axiom T12 : Red Harry
axiom T13 : Rough Harry
axiom T14 : Smart Harry

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x ∧ Nice x → White x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x → Smart x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x ∧ White x → Rough x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x ∧ White x → Red x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Red x ∧ Furry x → Nice x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Red x ∧ Furry x → Young x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x ∧ White x → Furry x

theorem gary_is_young : Young Gary :=
begin
  apply R6,
  split,
  apply R4,
  split,
  apply R3,
  split,
  exact T9,
  apply R1,
  split,
  apply R2,
  exact T9,
  exact T10,
  exact T9,
end

-- The answer is True
